text:
- Let's go to the top of
the course where we have

our oldest contestants
of the day, Scott and Pete.

both: We're dads!
- Yeah.

- They're dads.
- A lot of dads I know were,

like, playing poker
with their buddies.

- Yep.
- Yep.

- You two come to "Wipeout."
- Not wipeout. Wife out,

'cause our wives are letting us
out of the house tonight.

- Oh. Welcome to Wifeout.
- So it's like a hall pass,

but you're only
screwing yourself.
[air horn blares]

- There's the horn,
and Pete heads off

for Face Time with Nicole.
- Oh, yeah!

- This guy falls like a guy
in his late 20s.

- Old Dad Scott
into the Slosh Bucket.

- Let's go, Scott!
Shake it and bake it.

- Pete's throwing down
the most modern of slang.

Must be how he connects
with his kids.

- Meanwhile, Scott hoping
to connect with the platform.

- Ooh! But just like
his youth,

he can't hang on
no matter how hard he tries.
- Look at this hustle.

They don't have dad bods.
They have rad bods.

- All right, let's go,
Sweet Pete.
- Come on!

- Pete's old knees
are cracking.

Up onto the Big Balls. Ooh.
- Ah!

- Got lost around
that second ball.

- Just not in his nature
to ask for directions.

- Pete's looking to show
he's still got it
on the Insta-Slam.

- Moving like a man
trying to avoid his family.

- Come on! Come on.
Ride that horse, buddy.

- Ooh. I don't know
if he's going to be able

to have any more kids,
after that.

- Despite their age,
they're going all out.
- Move that dad bod!

both: Ooh.
- That's all right. Let's go.

- The Old Dads set the first
time of the day at 6...

- You got it. You got it.
- Minutes and 53 seconds.

That may get them
into the gauntlet,

but I'm not sure these two
have enough left in the tank

to avoid their wives
much longer than that.

[together]
Wifeout.

- Moving ahead
to the top of the course...

both: Farts and feet.
Farts and feet. Farts and feet.
- Farts and feet?

Sounds like a 13-year-old's
favorite subreddit.
- This is Justin and Kelsey.

They've only been dating
a few months,

but they're very comfortable
with each other.

- We just fart in front
of each other.

- I've never farted.
We don't do that.

- Yeah, never.
- Is there anything else

that you've learned
about one another?

- My thing is feet.
I have to show you her feet.

- Let's move on before
this ends up on Wikifeet.

- Oh, John, it's far
too late for that.
- Bring me those feet, babe!

- Little stinker Kelsey
gunning it through Face Time.

- Yeah!
- Flipped.

- [farts]
- Oh!

Gets the wind
knocked out of her.
- Which is more weird,
their love of farts...
- [raspberries]

- Or the feet?
- Hey, check those feet.
They're all--
[fart noises]
- I have to go the farts.

Doesn't anybody want
privacy these days?
- Apparently not.

- Little stinker Justin now
onto Insta-Slam.
- Go, babe!

- And immediately
gets the splats.
- Go, babe!
- Oh, my God. Did he...

- Yep. He just took
his shoe off.

- Now he's trying to show
off his feet.
[jazzy music]
- Oh!

- Nothing worse than
a wet sock.

- The Lil Stinkers are behind
the pace set by the Old Dads,

but a strong finish here
on Backbone

could help secure a spot
in the gauntlet.

- Ah!
- Ooh. That was a wet one.
The water.

- Kelsey, follow the farts!
- I'm coming.

- And this is
the perfect opportunity

to introduce our audience
to the
Oh, [bleep] cam,

a specialty camera
that captures the exact moment
where contestants go from,

"This isn't so bad,"
to, "Oh, [bleep]!"
- Can we say that?

- Observe.
This guy's face says,
"Oh, hell no." Yikes.

- And this lady says,
"I turned down
"Wheel of Fortune" for this?"

- Oh!
- Here's,

"I haven't been this
humiliated

since I wore a manpony
on national television.

- And my favorite...
- No! No! No!

- No, no, no! Yes, yes, yes!
No, no no!
Oh, [bleep]. John, who's next?
